sentence: Third quarter activity at the Yacktman Fund ( Trades , Portfolio ) ( YACKX ) was sparse.
The managers bought no new stocks in the third quarter and added only to three.
The fund holds 43 stocks and had a total value of $11.5 billion at quarter-end.
The Yacktmans have 35.4% of the fund vested in Consumer Defensive stocks as their largest sector.
The three stock positions to which they added more shares in the third quarter were: Oracle Corp ( ORCL ), Twenty-First Century Fox Inc. ( FOX ) and Procter & Gamble Co. ( PG ).
Yacktman increased his stake in Twenty-First Century Fox Inc. by 13% in the third quarter, to 9.144 million shares.
The stock accounts for 2.7% of the portfolio.
Its third quarter average share price was $34.
Oracle Corporation was incorporated in 2005 as a Delaware corporation and is the successor to operations originally begun in June 1977.
Oracle Corporation has a market cap of $166.44 billion; its shares were traded at around $37.56 with a P/E ratio of 15.70 and P/S ratio of 4.50.
The dividend yield of Oracle Corporation stocks is 1.30%.
Oracle Corporation had an annual average earnings growth of 18.00% over the past 10 years.
GuruFocus rated Oracle Corporation the business predictability rank of 4.5-star.
Yacktman increased his position in Oracle Corp 9.9%, buying 1.19 million for a total of 13.19 million.
The position accounted for 4.4% of his portfolio.
The stock's third quarter average share price was $41.
Twenty-First Century Fox Inc. is a Delaware corporation, incorporated in Nov. 12, 2004.
Twenty-first Century Fox Inc. has a market cap of $69.12 billion; its shares were traded at around $31.56 with a P/E ratio of 16.20 and P/S ratio of 2.30.
The dividend yield of Twenty-first Century Fox Inc. stocks is 0.80%.
Twenty-first Century Fox Inc. had an annual average earnings growth of 11.80% over the past five years.
Yacktman increased his stake in Procter & Gamble 3.2%, buying 600,000 shares for a total of 10.65 million.
The position is 8.2% of his portfolio.
The stock's price averaged $81 in the quarter.
Procter & Gamble Co., an Ohio corporation was incorporated in 1905.
Procter & Gamble Co. has a market cap of $222.68 billion; its shares were traded at around $82.24 with a P/E ratio of 20.90 and P/S ratio of 2.90.
The dividend yield of Procter & Gamble Co. stocks is 3.0%.
Procter & Gamble Co. had an annual average earnings growth of 2.7% over the past 10 years.
GuruFocus rated Procter & Gamble Co. the business predictability rank of 1-star.
